fashionRetailer.title: ESG Compliance Journey of a Fashion Retailer
fashionRetailer.section1Text: This well-established European fashion retailer has long championed quality and design longevity as part of its brand identity. These values inherently align with the principles of sustainable development. As the regulatory environment around sustainability disclosures evolved, the company recognized the need to transition from informal practices to structured ESG compliance, particularly in light of the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).
fashionRetailer.section2Intro: Despite a history of responsible product design and resource use, it was the upcoming CSRD requirements that catalyzed the company's formal ESG journey. The leadership team viewed ESG reporting as both a regulatory obligation and a strategic opportunity to:
fashionRetailer.section2Item1: Strengthen customer engagement by showcasing responsible business practices
fashionRetailer.section2Item2: Prepare the organization for investor and stakeholder expectations
fashionRetailer.section2Outro: The company also identified a growing commercial upside in ESG efforts. Consumer willingness to pay a premium for sustainable products and packaging reinforced the business case for transparent sustainability reporting.
fashionRetailer.section3Intro: To navigate the compliance process efficiently and accurately, the company partnered with Envirly, a platform combining advanced ESG software with expert advisory.
fashionRetailer.section3Item1: In-depth regulatory knowledge (CSRD, ESRS, GHG Protocol)
fashionRetailer.section3Item3: High user satisfaction with the platform's intuitive interface
fashionRetailer.section4Intro: To ensure smooth implementation and compliance, the company created a steering committee, composed of:
fashionRetailer.section4Item3: A representative from finance and administration
fashionRetailer.section4Outro: This core team was supported by stakeholders from HR, logistics, IT, controlling, and product development. The company also plans to bring on a dedicated ESG coordinator to oversee long-term sustainability strategy and regulatory reporting.
fashionRetailer.section5Title: 05. Outcomes of the ESG Compliance Process
fashionRetailer.section5Item1: Full visibility into emissions across Scopes 1, 2, and 3
fashionRetailer.section5Item2: Streamlined data collection and internal ESG processes
fashionRetailer.section5Item3: Enhanced stakeholder alignment around sustainability goals
fashionRetailer.section5Item4: Organizational readiness for upcoming ESRS-aligned reporting obligations
fashionRetailer.summaryItem1Text: CSRD compliance requires months of preparation and organizational coordination.
fashionRetailer.summaryItem2Text: A reliable partner helps demystify complex regulations.
fashionRetailer.summaryItem3Text: ESG is a horizontal topic that spans departments.
fashionRetailer.summaryItem4Text: Assign ownership to ensure the process stays on track.

logisticsGroup.title: A Leading Logistics Group's ESG Transformation
logisticsGroup.section1Text: The company has been actively engaged in sustainability initiatives for many years, including supporting businesses in over 150 countries in developing modern workplace cultures built on trust and performance.
logisticsGroup.section2Text: The biggest challenge was identifying and collecting the right data for ESG reporting—particularly carbon footprint data, which is critical in the TSL sector. As a logistics operator, not just a transport provider, the company required expert guidance to determine which data sets were necessary to meet the requirements of the CSRD directive.
logisticsGroup.section3Intro: The collaboration consisted of several key phases:
logisticsGroup.section3Item1: Double Materiality Assessment – identifying the most relevant environmental, social, and governance topics for the company and its stakeholders
logisticsGroup.section3Item2: Carbon Footprint Calculation – estimation of GHG emissions across Scopes 1, 2, and 3
logisticsGroup.section3Item3: Governance & HR Policy Analysis – including anti-mobbing procedures, whistleblower protection, and anti-corruption measures
logisticsGroup.section3Item4: Sustainability Strategy Development – building internal know-how and capabilities
logisticsGroup.section3Item5: Training for Employees – to ensure a broader understanding of ESG principles
logisticsGroup.section3Item6: ESG Communication Strategy – defining the company's narrative and messaging
logisticsGroup.section4Title: 05. "We Want to Stay Ahead of Market Demands"
logisticsGroup.section4Text: The client values competitiveness across all aspects of its business. It continuously improves TSL processes, measures performance, and assesses the effectiveness of initiatives across all subsidiaries. Through the partnership with Envirly, the organization gained tools and skills for monitoring, analyzing, and verifying sustainability metrics and ESG data.
logisticsGroup.summaryItem1: Comprehensive ESG strategy aligned with industry best practices
logisticsGroup.summaryItem2: Accurate carbon footprint measurement across all operations
logisticsGroup.summaryItem3: Enhanced internal capabilities for ongoing ESG management
logisticsGroup.summaryItem4: Competitive advantage through early CSRD compliance

financialServices.title: Driving ESG Compliance Through Innovation in Financial Services
financialServices.section1Text: As ESG regulations grow more demanding, especially with the upcoming Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD), the bank recognized the urgent need to support its clients—especially SMEs and corporate clients—in aligning with these new standards.
financialServices.section2Text: "Companies need more than capital—they need support in meeting ESG goals and compliance requirements," said the bank's Executive Director of Sustainable Development. The chosen solution—a digital ESG compliance platform—supports reporting aligned with GHG Protocol and ISO 14064-1. During the pilot phase, clients used the platform to calculate their emissions and track reductions linked to energy efficiency improvements and building upgrades.
financialServices.section3Intro: Through the partnership, the bank equipped its clients with tools to:
financialServices.section3Item3: Visualize ESG data with dashboards, infographics, and automated reports
financialServices.section3Item4: Identify hotspots and track progress toward climate goals
financialServices.section3Outro: The solution, powered by artificial intelligence, also simplifies the complex process of ESG data aggregation and supply chain emissions tracking—a critical capability for upcoming CSRD-aligned disclosures.
financialServices.section4Benefit1Text: Business clients gained access to the platform at no cost during the pilot and now benefit from tailored ESG support at preferential rates.
financialServices.section4Benefit2Text: The solution provides structured, regulation-aligned reporting, helping clients prepare for CSRD requirements and beyond.
financialServices.section4Benefit3Text: Clients identified high-emission activities and implemented reduction strategies, leading to greater operational efficiency and lower costs.
financialServices.section4Benefit4Text: The platform delivers accurate, verifiable emissions data based on robust methodologies, supporting informed and credible decision-making.
financialServices.section5Intro: Thanks to this collaboration, the bank's clients can now:
financialServices.section5Item2: Comply with CSRD and other ESG regulations
financialServices.section5Outro: The platform's automation and AI capabilities reduce the burden of ESG reporting while enhancing transparency and stakeholder trust.
financialServices.section6Text1: This case study highlights how strategic partnerships between financial institutions and ESG tech providers can accelerate compliance, empower businesses, and contribute to the broader EU goal of net-zero emissions by 2050.
financialServices.section6Text2: By digitizing ESG data management and making compliance tools broadly available, the bank plays a critical role in building market resilience, climate awareness, and long-term competitiveness among its clients.
